news.title: Shree Cement posts net profit of ₹643.66 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Shree Cement's net consolidated profit surged by 131.16% to ₹643.66 crore in Q1 FY26, driven by a 4.81% increase in total income to ₹5,516.11 crore. The company's UAE operations witnessed substantial growth, with operating profit soaring by 397%.

news.title: Akzo Nobel India's net profit declines 20.59% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Akzo Nobel India's net consolidated profit witnessed a 20.59% decline in Q1 FY26, reaching ₹91 crore, while total income dipped by 4.01% to ₹1,004.10 crore. Despite subdued retail performance due to tepid consumer demand, the B2B segment maintained its growth. The board declared a special interim dividend of ₹156 per share and completed the sale of property at Navi Mumbai.

news.title: DLF's net profit rises by 18.30% in Q1 FY26
news.para: DLF experienced substantial growth in Q1 FY26, with net consolidated profit rising by 18.30% to ₹762.67 crore. The company's total income surged by 72.32% to ₹2,980.88 crore, driven by strong new sales bookings of ₹11,425 crore, a 78% year-on-year increase.

news.title: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar: CSMC expects revenue boost as all properties can avail amnesty
news.para: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar Municipal Corporation (CSMC) anticipates a revenue surge this fiscal year, expanding its property tax amnesty scheme to include commercial and industrial properties. The 'Freedom from Penalty' scheme offers residential owners a 95% concession on late payment charges until August 15.

news.title: Flat owners to seek Kerala government intervention in setting up sewage treatment plants
news.para: Kochi apartment complexes face challenges in installing sewage treatment plants (STPs) due to space constraints, prompting COFVOAK to seek government intervention. They propose utilizing existing STPs and expediting the IURWTS project, which includes city-wide STPs. MLA T J Vinod has raised the issue with the industries minister, advocating for proactive government measures to address the space limitations.

news.title: Rajasthan's stone crusher, small mine associations on strike
news.para: Mining activities in Rajasthan have stopped. Rajasthan Stone Crusher Association and Rajasthan Small Mines started a strike. The strike is due to government's mining policies. The associations demand changes to mineral rules. They want consistent royalty rates and industry classification. They also seek protection from unauthorized mining liability. The associations will submit a memorandum to the state government.

news.title: To map properties in Karnataka, Centre’s nod sought to fly drones in 353 red zone villages
news.para: Karnataka is awaiting approval from the Union ministry to conduct drone surveys in 353 red zone villages under the SVAMITVA scheme. This initiative aims to provide legal ownership records and resolve land disputes by March 2026. Surveys have been completed in 23,338 villages, with draft property cards prepared for 10.2 lakh properties in 4,125 villages.

news.title: HC asks government to halt illegal constructions in Bhopal's Arera Colony
news.para: Madhya Pradesh High Court is now hearing a petition about illegal construction in Bhopal's Arera Colony. Petitioners want the court to stop shops and other commercial buildings. The area is for homes, but many commercial buildings exist. The court told the government and other groups to respond.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body enforces pollution rules for private sites, ignores own
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation lags in installing air quality sensors at its construction sites. This is despite requiring private builders to do so. Many AMC projects lack these sensors. Fees are collected, but installations are slow. Only one agency is reliably installing and maintaining the sensors. The city has seen air quality improvements and received an incentive grant.

news.title: Gurugram moves ahead with phase-I construction bids for new metro corridor
news.para: Gurugram is set to enhance its metro connectivity. GMRL will likely award the contract for the Millennium City Centre-Cyber City metro's first phase soon. Construction is expected to begin by September. The initial phase includes a 15.2km elevated line with 14 stations. This project aims to improve connectivity to residential and commercial areas.

news.title: Maharashtra: Housing experts raise red flags over Darekar panel report on self-redevelopment
news.para: Housing activists are criticizing the Pravin Darekar committee's self-redevelopment recommendations, arguing they weaken key benefits from the 2019 GR and introduce new obstacles for middle-class homeowners. Concerns include the reduced FSI incentive, the 30-year age eligibility criterion, and the shift in TDR procurement discounts. Activists are urging a review to address these issues and ensure a supportive self-redevelopment policy.

news.title: Hyderabad's Old City corridor to affect 900 properties
news.para: Hyderabad Metro Rail's MGBS to Chandrayangutta corridor road widening is progressing, with property impact reduced to 900 through redesign. Challenges include dense housing and utility lines, addressed by cautious night work. Groundwork for metro construction is underway, including soil testing and DGPS surveys to finalize pillar locations, minimizing disruption to historical sites.

news.title: Housing societies in Maharashtra cautioned against fake tenant registration documents
news.para: Maharashtra housing societies are facing a surge in fraudulent tenant registration documents, prompting alerts from service providers. Forged leave and license agreements, often altered PDFs, are being submitted, potentially causing legal issues for landlords.

news.title: Additional 20% deposit for project registration extension: Tamil Nadu RERA
news.para: To protect homebuyers from project delays, TNRERA now requires developers seeking project registration extensions beyond a year to deposit an extra 20% of collected funds into the project account. This move aims to ensure sufficient funds for construction and prevent diversion. Small builders, however, worry about the impact on their cash flow, especially when delays are due to natural causes.

news.title: HC stays YEIDA's order to cancel land allotted to Greenbay Infrastructure over ₹118 crore dues
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has temporarily prevented YEIDA from cancelling Greenbay Infrastructure's land allotment for its Sector 22D township project. This order is pending the state government's decision on Greenbay's request for relief under the 'zero period' policy, citing incomplete land possession.

news.title: Haryana RERA penalises Shine Buildcon for four-year delay in unit handover in Gurugram
news.para: Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority directed Shine Buildcon to pay interest to a complainant. The interest rate is 11.1% per annum for a delay in handing over a commercial unit. The project, '70 Grandwalk', faced a delay of over four years. HRera also addressed illegal charges levied by the developer.

news.title: NCLT excludes Phoenix ARC from committee of creditors in Hotel Horizon case
news.para: The NCLT partially approved Hotel Horizon's promoters' plea, excluding Phoenix ARC's claim from the CIRP due to limitation. Oberoi Realty's consortium secured CoC approval to acquire the company for Rs 919 crore. The tribunal instructed a claim rework for JMFARC and directed reverification of UBI's claims, while CFM ARC appeals the Phoenix ARC decision.

news.title: Sirca Paints' profit rises 39% to ₹14 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Sirca Paints India witnessed a significant surge in its consolidated net profit, soaring by 39.2% to reach Rs 14.20 crore in the first quarter, fueled by robust growth in both margin and sales. The company's revenue from operations also experienced a substantial increase of 45.26%, climbing to Rs 114.24 crore during the same period.

news.title: Godrej Properties plans its largest-ever bond issue: Sources
news.para: Godrej Properties is preparing to issue its largest corporate bond offering this month, aiming to raise approximately 20 billion rupees ($230 million). The real estate developer will offer shorter-duration bonds with maturities ranging from three to five years.
